content.description: A nice arete climb up the large boulder at the base of the hill. Layback up the arete to a good jug at the angle change. From the jug transition onto the left side of the arete and follow it using a nice rail to the horn at the very top of the boulder.
content.location: The tall arete on the large boulder at the base of the hill. This is the first rock you come to from the trail.

content.description: Climbs the slightly overhanging finger crack on the upper ledge above the swamp. Sit start off the nice ledge about five feet up. Tough jams get you to a good face hold at the lip. Get your feet up and reach up and right to find a good pinch hold. Use this to get your foot up over the lip. Finish with a great hand jam to get you to the top. Terrible landing. Do not fail once your past the lip!
content.location: Scramble up and left through the boulders to reach the base of this slightly overhanging ledge. You can't miss the really obvious finger crack.

content.description: Finger crack to face holds to a hand jam. This is the boulder problem you can see from the boardwalk and is the first boulder you come to from the trail. Sit start the thin finger crack. Bump out to good face holds then transition into the widening crack above using a nice hand jam to escape to the top.
content.location: First thing you come to along the trail. Look for the obvious, slightly left-leaning finger crack.

content.description: Vulture Rocks is a jumble of boulders and ledge that sits on a steep hillside at the edge of the swamp. A popular place for the local kids to build forts, it also provides several nice boulder problems. Best visited in late summer or fall when the bugs have died off. The hillside faces west and gets a fair amount of afternoon sun.
